articles.author: JAIMIE DING, CHRISTOPHER WEBER and JULIE WATSON
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — California firefighters battled wind-whipped wildfires that tore across the Los Angeles area, destroying homes, clogging roadways as tens of thousands fled and straining resources as officials prepared for the situation to worsen early Wednesday.
articles.title: Thousands flee as wildfires burn out of control in and around Los Angeles and homes are destroyed

articles.author: WILL WEISSERT and ZEKE MILLER
articles.description: PALM BEACH, Fla. (AP) — President-elect Donald Trump on Tuesday said he would not rule out the use of military force to seize control of the Panama Canal and Greenland, as he declared U.S.
articles.title: Trump refuses to rule out use of military force to take control of Greenland and the Panama Canal

articles.author: ERIC TUCKER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — A federal judge on Tuesday temporarily blocked the public release of special counsel Jack Smith's report on investigations into Donald Trump as an appeals court weighs a challenge to the disclosure of a much-anticipated document just days before the president-elect reclaims office.
articles.title: Judge temporarily blocks release of special counsel report on Trump cases as court fight simmers

articles.author: HANNAH FINGERHUT and BEN FINLEY
articles.description: NORFOLK, Va. (AP) — A developing winter storm threatens to drop snow, sleet and freezing rain on parts of Texas, Oklahoma and Arkansas as frigid air that escaped the Arctic plunges temperatures to subfreezing levels in some of the southernmost points of the U.S.
articles.title: Southern US shivers as new winter storm threatens snow for Texas, Oklahoma and Arkansas

articles.author: KEN MORITSUGU and CHRISTOPHER BODEEN
articles.description: BEIJING (AP) — Rescuers in the freezing, high-altitude Tibet region in western China searched a second day for any remaining victims of a deadly earthquake that struck near a holy city for Tibetan Buddhists, before shifting their focus to resettling the survivors.
articles.title: Tents arrive for survivors of a quake that killed 126 in freezing, high-altitude Tibet

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: Israeli airstrikes in southern Gaza killed at least 17 people late Tuesday, nearly all of them women or children, the territory’s Health Ministry and hospital officials said.Five kids were killed as they sheltered together in the same tent, said Ahmed al-Farra, director of the children's ward at nearby Nasser Hospital in Khan Younis.
articles.title: Middle East latest: Israeli strikes kill 17 people in Gaza, nearly all of them women or kids

articles.author: TIA GOLDENBERG
articles.description: TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — When Luis Har was kidnapped by Hamas-led militants on the warm morning of Oct. 7, 2023, he was forced into Gaza wearing shorts and a T-shirt. As his captivity stretched into weeks and then months, the cold, wet winter set in, bringing along with it a dread he had never endured before.
articles.title: Hostages in Gaza endure another winter as their families plead for a ceasefire

articles.author: BILL BARROW
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Jimmy Carter will continue to lie in state Wednesday after his remains arrived in Washington a day earlier as part of state funeral rites. The Georgia Democrat and 39th president died Dec.
articles.title: Jimmy Carter continues to lie in state at Capitol Rotunda ahead of his state funeral

articles.author: BILL BARROW
articles.description: PLAINS, Ga. (AP) — The world knew Jimmy Carter as a president and humanitarian, but he also was a woodworker, painter and poet, creating a body of artistic work that reflects deeply personal views of the global community — and himself.
articles.title: Jimmy Carter's woodworking, painting and poetry reveal an introspective Renaissance Man

articles.author: DOUG GLASS
articles.description:
Strong winds that sent wildfires ripping through the mountains and foothills around Los Angeles on Tuesday fed a spectacle of smoke, flames and flight.Large flames
Vivid orange flames lit the sky in the Pacific Palisades neighborhood, where firefighters dragged hoses to meet blazes flaring up in brush dried out by persistent drought.
articles.title: See photos of fire, smoke and flight as wildfires race across Southern California
